intro: Quaqua tentaculata, commonly known as the sea holly, is a marine flowering plant found in shallow coastal waters. It belongs to the family Goodeniaceae and is characterized by its distinctive blue or purple flowers and feathery leaves. The plant thrives in sandy or muddy substrates and is often found in tidal zones. Its unique structure allows it to withstand harsh coastal conditions, including salt spray and wave action. Quaqua tentaculata plays an important role in coastal ecosystems by providing habitat for various marine organisms.
